In this study, the researchers focus on oak wood and incorporate the Kubelka-Munk theory along with self-learning procedures to create the color prediction tool. The tool takes into account the colorimetric and spectral properties of both the dying material and the wood substrate, which are obtained through previous analysis. By considering these parameters, the model can accurately predict the resulting color in wood by using the L* C* h degrees coordinates. The study also investigates the effects of different dye application methods, such as by hand with a brush or by machine with a roller coating, as well as the influence of varnishing.
